posts.post_content:
+ [Intruder Alarm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Intruder Alarm) + pretty much any creature = WIN  
  
Other ideas:  
  
[Acidic Slime](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Acidic Slime) = munch a land every turn  
[Avenger of Zendikar](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Avenger of Zendikar) = epic Plant token army  
[Fleshbag Marauder](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fleshbag Marauder) = Opponent sacs a creature, you sac the token, every turn  
[Malakir Bloodwitch](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Malakir Bloodwitch) = Huge life sapping every turn  
[Ranger of Eos](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ranger of Eos) = Zoo decks just got crazier  
[Sanity Gnawers](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sanity Gnawers) = Random discard every turn  
[Siege-Gang Commander](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Siege-Gang Commander) = 4 more goblins to sac each turn  
[Terastodon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Terastodon) = ZOMG EVERYTHING IS ELEPHANTS  
[Venerated Teacher](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Venerated Teacher) = Levelers go nuts  
[Vampire Hexmage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vampire Hexmage) = Kill a planeswalker every turn  
  
Any Eldrazi Spawn token generator = tons of tokens  
Any Ally = obvious  
  
And that's just in standard.

posts.post_content:
[Sky Hussar](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sky Hussar) also works wonders. And it has the benefit of untapping all of your creatures. Possibly a pinger if attacking for the win is impossible.  
  
But the best scenario would look like this:  
T1: Land, something.  
T2: Land, something.  
T3: Land, P@ss. End of opponent's turn, cast [Pestermite](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pestermite).   
T4: Land. Splinter Twin on the 'mite.   
T5: Land. Attack with 13144 faeries. Protect with [Pact of Negation](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pact of Negation). Win (unless opponent has somehow put an [Avatar of Hope](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Avatar of Hope) or [Empyrial Archangel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Empyrial Archangel) on the bord).

posts.post_content:
ATTN: You do NOT need toughness-boosting effects of any kind to make this work on a Clone-type creature. If you make a copy of something that has copied something else, such as this on Clone, then the new (token) copy is an exact copy of what the Clone is copying, not a copy of a clone copying something, and not a Clone copying nothing. fo yo infomation.  
  
Also, even if the clone was copying nothing, was still alive, and you didn't have toughness-boosting effects, the token would still be able to use the ENTER THE BATTLEFIELD AS A COPY OF ANY CREATURE ability of clone.  
  
What I think you meant, informative guy who posted, was that in order to use Clone's ability every time yo use Splinter Twin, you'd have to have a toughness-boosting effect. Just clarifying this sh\*t for people who have no idea.
posts.html:
ATTN: You do NOT need toughness-boosting effects of any kind to make this work on a Clone-type creature. If you make a copy of something that has copied something else, such as this on Clone, then the new (token) copy is an exact copy of what the Clone is copying, not a copy of a clone copying something, and not a Clone copying nothing. fo yo infomation.

Also, even if the clone was copying nothing, was still alive, and you didn't have toughness-boosting effects, the token would still be able to use the ENTER THE BATTLEFIELD AS A COPY OF ANY CREATURE ability of clone.

What I think you meant, informative guy who posted, was that in order to use Clone's ability every time yo use Splinter Twin, you'd have to have a toughness-boosting effect. Just clarifying this sh*t for people who have no idea.

posts.post_content:
This card is so win. You can literally do anything you want with it. Generate tokens, Destroy land, Level up creatures, gain life, or swing with a big fatty every turn with no second thought. Here are a few silly good cards to equip this to.  
  
[Pelakka Wurm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pelakka Wurm) - Seven life a turn, yes plz.  
[Acidic Slime](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Acidic Slime) - no land for you!  
[Venerated Teacher](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Venerated Teacher) - Level me up scotty!  
[Avenger of Zendikar](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Avenger of Zendikar) - ZOMG plants!  
[Spellbound Dragon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Spellbound Dragon) - Ouch my face!  
[Thraximundar](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Thraximundar) - Nom Nom Nom  
Eldarzi Token Generators.  
  
Thats just standard... The possibilities of this card are only limited by your imagination. If you want something done this card will do it for you... Expensive, but what you get for your mana is just nuts.  
  
The only downside is that the token is exiled. So that can limit what you can do. But for most triggers that have enter the graveyard effects they can be duplicated with enter the battl... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
This card is so win. You can literally do anything you want with it. Generate tokens, Destroy land, Level up creatures, gain life, or swing with a big fatty every turn with no second thought. Here are a few silly good cards to equip this to.

Pelakka Wurm - Seven life a turn, yes plz.
Acidic Slime - no land for you!
Venerated Teacher - Level me up scotty!
Avenger of Zendikar - ZOMG plants!
Spellbound Dragon - Ouch my face!
Thraximundar - Nom Nom Nom
Eldarzi Token Generators.

Thats just standard... The possibilities of this card are only limited by your imagination. If you want something done this card will do it for you... Expensive, but what you get for your mana is just nuts.

The only downside is that the token is exiled. So that can limit what you can do. But for most triggers that have enter the graveyard effects they can be duplicated with enter the battl... (see all)

posts.post_content:
ATTN: You do NOT need toughness-boosting effects of any kind to make this work on a Clone-type creature. If you make a copy of something that has copied something else, such as this on Clone, then the new (token) copy is an exact copy of what the Clone is copying, not a copy of a clone copying something, and not a Clone copying nothing. fo yo infomation.  
  
Also, even if the clone was copying nothing, was still alive, and you didn't have toughness-boosting effects, the token would still be able to use the ENTER THE BATTLEFIELD AS A COPY OF ANY CREATURE ability of clone.  
  
What I think you meant, informative guy who posted, was that in order to use Clone's ability every time yo use Splinter Twin, you'd have to have a toughness-boosting effect. Just clarifying this sh\*t for people who have no idea.
posts.html:
ATTN: You do NOT need toughness-boosting effects of any kind to make this work on a Clone-type creature. If you make a copy of something that has copied something else, such as this on Clone, then the new (token) copy is an exact copy of what the Clone is copying, not a copy of a clone copying something, and not a Clone copying nothing. fo yo infomation.

Also, even if the clone was copying nothing, was still alive, and you didn't have toughness-boosting effects, the token would still be able to use the ENTER THE BATTLEFIELD AS A COPY OF ANY CREATURE ability of clone.

What I think you meant, informative guy who posted, was that in order to use Clone's ability every time yo use Splinter Twin, you'd have to have a toughness-boosting effect. Just clarifying this sh*t for people who have no idea.
